questions.question: What is the acceleration due to gravity on Earth?
questions.explanation: The standard acceleration due to gravity on Earth is approximately 9.8 m/s².

questions.question: What is the chemical symbol for Gold?
questions.explanation: Gold's chemical symbol is Au, derived from its Latin name 'aurum'.

questions.question: What is the powerhouse of the cell?
questions.explanation: Mitochondria are known as the powerhouse of the cell as they generate ATP.

questions.question: Who was the first emperor of Rome?
questions.explanation: Augustus (originally Octavian) was the first Roman Emperor.

questions.question: In which year did World War II end?
questions.explanation: World War II ended in 1945 with the surrender of Japan.

questions.question: What is the highest mountain in the world?
questions.explanation: Mount Everest is the highest mountain in the world at 8,848.86 meters.

questions.question: What is the capital of Canada?
questions.explanation: Ottawa is the capital city of Canada.
